prompt: Two terrified college kids sit knees-to-knees in a dim bedroom, neon laptop glow painting their faces; pixels lift off the screen like fireflies, turning their skin translucent with scrolling green code, reality glitching around them as they clutch each other, mouths open in silent scream—vivid cyber-thriller lighting, cinematic 2.39:1.

Zoom on Elliot’s face: left eye flickers Sarah’s brown iris, right eye mirrors green ASCII terror; a pixel tear rises as binary-blinking lids spell HELP, laptop still shut yet glowing faintly in pupils.
Zoom on Elliot’s blinking eyes; iris-pixels pour scrolling binary “WE NEVER LEFT” into viewer’s reflection while translucent terminal HUD overlays both faces, walls behind flash console-red.
